title: Is history a part of culture? - Quora

response.answer_text: Culture are things that are intangible. Examples would be oral histories, songs, dance, handicraft skills. Pretty much everything that a particular group have innovated & passed down the generations. So history is part of culture.

Is history culture? When two or more people live in the same area they have to adopt some rules about who does what to whom. Any such rule is called a moré, French accented e pronounced "mor-ay". The adjective form is moral, and the habit of following morés is morality. Morés are arbitrary: they do not have to be right, only accepted. Another group on the other side of the river might have very different morés. A collection of morés defines a culture. If a culture lasts a while then we call that “history”.
